abstract: Rachel Beyda, student at University of California, Los Angeles, endures pointed questions about her Jewish identity during confirmation hearing on her nomination to student council's Judicial Board; debate centers on Beyda's affiliation with Jewish organizations and how it might subject her to bias; Jewish leaders say discussion echoes anti-Semitic tropes that have plagued Jews for centuries.
lead_paragraph: A student board debated whether the religion of a second-year economics major meant she would be biased in dealing with sensitive governance questions, and the discussion has upended the campus.

headline.main: In U.C.L.A. Debate Over Jewish Student, Echoes on Campus of Old Biases
headline.print_headline: In a Debate on Campus Over a Jewish Student, Echoes of Old Biases

snippet: A student board debated whether the religion of a second-year economics major meant she would be biased in dealing with sensitive governance questions, and the discussion has upended the campus.

keywords.value: Hillel, The Foundation for Jewish Campus Life
keywords.name: organizations
